author: ProfessorBrickkeeper
title: A nice set that fills the "Music" Gap in LEGO Sets
review:
Set: 850486 MF ROCK BAND SET
Ages: 6+
Pieces: 62
Item: 6016929
Price: $14.99 USD

This cool little gem of a set that I picked up at LEGOLAND California along with 850487 MF HALLOWEEN SET on Sunday is worth the money if you are lucky enough to come across it somewhere. It has a reused pieces that may be hard to find on their own including 2 Microphone elements, and an awesome Lime-Green Mohawk element reused from the Punk Rocker, though not much else. I found the design of the different components that make up the instruments to be nice and realistic with nice use of the elements to be true to real instruments designs.
The Minifigures are clearly the center of the set as they appear to have been where most of LEGO's effort were focused. They differ from their original CMS counterpart by use of variations in the elements such as the different head, Torso decal, and hat for the "Singer/Rapper", the Lime-Green Mohawk used for the "Drummer/Male Punk Rocker" ,the Black hair and reprinted White Torso and Pants for the "Gutairist/Female Punk Rocker". All the Minifigures also feature new printed pants then their CMS counterparts. The Minifigures also successfully vary from the CMS versions to retain their aspect of being unique.

author: Firox_5000
title: Lego Rock Band set
review:
When I saw  lego release a mini figure collection of a rock band, I knew I had to buy it when it came out. 

The set comes in a small clear plastic box which isn't like the usual lego packaging. Once opened, the figures are technically ready built so it's only the accessories  including the drum kit,guitar, mic stand, lights and amps that need building. The building process  is very quick and takes less than 5 minutes to complete.

The figures 
There are three figures in the set. The first figure is the vocalist of the band who comes with a microphone. He comes with a baseball style hat and bling printed torso and trousers and sunglasses on his head piece giving him a look of more a rapper than singer and also very similar in appearance to the series 3 one from the collectable mini figures. 

The second figure is the guitarist/bass player of the band who is wearing a lightning and stripped patterned torso and leg piece as well as a long and wild hair piece too. The head piece of the figure has a pink lightning stripe and eye makeup and light pink'ish lips showing that the figure is  a girl. 

The third and final figure is the drummer who has a decorated skull printed on his torso and is wearing a green spiked up hair piece giving him a punky look. He also comes with drum stick and a enthusiastic facial expression. 

The set
 The main object to the whole set is the drum kit. Though it doesn't appear to be the actual traditional layout of a kit, it is easily recognisable with the kick drum, tom drums and also a hi-hat and cymbal too which has a light metallic shine to it. Though not many pieces have been used here, it clearly does resemble a simple drum kit layout. 

The next object is the guitar/bass which unlike the drums isn't quite as recognisable as it is made up of many pieces. Though it resembles a guitar/bass, it doesn't quite look like one and also weather it's a guitar or bass. 

There is also two speakers in the set made of just four pieces each but work well as they can be identified as speakers. The set also includes a small stand with a microphone attached [probably for the guitarist] which is a nice added extra to the set. The lights are the final touches to the set and though they're nothing special add to the equipment and lineup making it look like a rock performance. 

Summary
If you're in to rock bands, a musician, collectable mini figure sets and a rock band set up for stop motions and town displays, this set is definitely for you. If you own at least one  [or more] of the series 4 and series 7 guitarists then you'll have a perfect sized rock band with several guitars and a bass. 

I genuinely recommend this set.
